name: Monument to Romul Bosch i Alsina

reviews.text:
This monument stands in tribute to Rómulo Bosch i Alsina, a Catalan doctor, politician and businessman. A former mayor of the city and chairman of the Board of Works of the Port of Barcelona where this sculpture stands.

The sculpture features a larger than life figure of Romul Bosch partly emerging from a large monolith. Only his upper torso and right leg is clearly visible, his shoulders are thrown back, causing his chest to appear disproportionately voluminous. I suppose it's supposed to represent the emergence of progress, but who knows.

The Monument to Romul Bosch i Alsina is quite an unusual sculpture. Romul Bosch i Alsina was a doctor , politician and businessman from Catalonia. Among many other things he was directly responsible for the development and modernisation of the port area, hence the presence of his monument there. Worth checking out.
